articles.description: A paucity of coal in the domestic market is pushing upwards the prices of sponge iron. Meanwhile, there has also been a squeeze on the availability of scrap steel, which is largely imported. This is pushing up the price of the commodity.
articles.content:
Medium and small steelmakers in India are feeling the heat as prices of key inputs like sponge iron and imported scrap steel continue to rise amid a correction in the prices of finished steel.

articles.title: These 2 govt-owned oil companies will turn ex-dividend this week. Details here | Mint - Mint
articles.description: ONGC is planning to pay a final dividend of 65% to its shareholders, while BPCL will make a payment of 60% dividend. These final dividends are for the financial year FY22. The ex-dividend date is the day that sets the list of eligible shareholders for the div…
articles.content: Two government-owned oil companies namely BPCL and ONGC are set to turn ex-dividend ahead of the record date on stock exchanges later this week. Both stocks will be in focus due to ex-dividend. Also,… [+4555 chars]
